verse:
वदन्ति कृष्ण श्रेयांसि बहूनि ब्रह्मवादिनः ।
तेषां विकल्पप्राधान्यमुताहो एकमुख्यता ॥

terms.brahma-vādinaḥ: the learned sages who have explained the Vedic literature

vedabase.translation: Śrī Uddhava said: My dear Kṛṣṇa, the learned sages who explain Vedic literature recommend various processes for perfecting one’s life. Considering these varieties of viewpoint, my Lord, please tell me whether all these processes are equally important, or whether one of them is supreme.
vedabase.purport: In order to clearly establish the exalted position of bhakti-yoga, or pure devotional service to the Supreme Lord, Śrī Uddhava requests Lord Kṛṣṇa to identify the supreme among all processes of self-realization. Not all Vedic processes lead directly to the ultimate goal, pure love of God; some only gradually elevate the consciousness of the living entity. For the purpose of giving a general outline of the process of self-realization, sages may discuss the various methods of elevation. But when the time comes to ascertain the most perfect process, the secondary methods must be cleared from the path.

terms.श्रेयांसि: the highest good or ultimate goal
terms.ब्रह्मवादिनः: wise sages or philosophers who know the Vedic scriptures
terms.विकल्पप्राधान्यम्: emphasis on diversity or various paths
terms.एकमुख्यता: the principle of unity or one-pointedness

terms.vadanti kṛṣṇa śreyāṁsi bahūni: ` there are many different descriptions of the highest good, kṛṣṇa `
terms.teṣām vikalpa prādhānyam uta: ` among them, the main division is between the dualists and non-dualists `
terms.aho eka mukhyatā: ` and of these, the non-dualists are superior `
